summary: This is a transcript of a sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 12, 2019, regarding the custody and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview covers Epstein's arrival, housing, suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, psychological evaluations, staffing issues, and the circumstances leading up to his death on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt / Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a cloth around his neck. An internal investigation was conducted. He stated he thought he was having a heart attack, not attempting suicide. He was placed on suicide watch following this incident.

events.title: Epstein Moved from Suicide Watch to Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was downgraded from suicide watch to psychological observation (psyche obs) while still on the second floor medical unit. Dr. determined he was not suicidal and was ready to return to the SHU.

events.title: Epstein Returned to SHU with Cellmate
events.description: Epstein was moved back to the Special Housing Unit. The Warden selected inmate as his cellmate after vetting three possibilities and getting approval from higher-ups.

events.title: Cellmate Discharged from MCC
events.description: Inmate was discharged from MCC 'with all belongings', leaving Epstein without a cellmate. The Warden was not aware of this until after Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:30 AM. Officer Michael Thomas initiated life-saving measures. Epstein was pronounced dead at an outside hospital. The Warden was notified at 6:50 AM.

events.title: OIG Interview of MCC Warden
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a sworn interview with the Warden of MCC regarding the custody and death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Suicide Watch cells (second floor of MCC)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at MCC unexpectedly on a weekend without prior notification to the Warden. He was initially placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and was never moved to general population on orders from the Regional Director.

Epstein had a prior incident on July 23, 2019, where he was found with a cloth around his neck. He denied a suicide attempt, saying he thought he was having a heart attack. He was placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to psychological observation before returning to the SHU with a cellmate ().

The Warden gave explicit orders that Epstein was to have a cellmate 'at all times' and instructed Captain to disseminate this to staff. However, after cellmate was discharged on August 9, Epstein was left alone in his cell. Staff failed to notify supervisors or find a replacement cellmate as instructed.

The MCC was understaffed (approx. 80%), relied on overtime, and had outdated, unreliable camera systems. The SIS Lieutenant had reported problems with the SHU camera recordings prior to Epstein's death.

On the morning of August 10, Officers Michael Thomas and Toba Noel were on duty in the SHU. The Warden stated that 30-minute inmate checks were not performed at 3 PM and 5 PM. Thomas was the first to respond to Epstein, initiating life-saving measures against protocol which advises waiting for backup.
